text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Pope John Paul demands the world to maintain peace in Lebanon.
-Palestinian refugee camps go on one-day strike to protest the 49th anniversary of Israel's independence day.
- "The army is not in a position of political competition with any body," army commander General Lahoud said in a statement that appeared to be a reply to Prime Minister Hariri.
- Foreign Minister Bouez in Bucharest calls to strong economic ties between Lebanon and Romania.
- Heavy Israeli shelling on south Lebanon.
- Hairi started three-day official visit to South Korea.
- Military magistrate demanded up to 15 years hard labour for a journalist accused of contacting Israeli agents in Lebanon.
